              com.rhizospherejs.gwt.client.Rhizosphere<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type that describes the datapoints of your dataset.
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, HasErrorHandlers, HasFilterHandlers, HasLayoutHandlers, HasModelChangeHandlers, HasReadyHandlers, HasSelectionHandlers
public class Rhizosphere<T>
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
implements HasReadyHandlers, HasFilterHandlers, HasLayoutHandlers, HasSelectionHandlers, HasModelChangeHandlers, HasErrorHandlers

Widget wrapping a Rhizosphere visualization. This is the main entry point for instantiating a Rhizosphere visualization within a GWT application. Learn more about Rhizosphere at docs.rhizospherejs.com

Before attaching the visualization to the DOM, ensure that:

  • The Rhizosphere javascript libraries have already been injected in the DOM (see RhizosphereLoader).
  • The visualization has been properly configured by defining metamodel and renderer the visualization will use. (see setMetaModel(RhizosphereMetaModel) and setRenderer(RhizosphereRenderer)).

To instantiate a Rhizosphere visualization:

  • Define the set of models to visualize. A model represents a single datapoint of the dataset you want to visualize. You can specify your models in variety of formats.
  • Define the visualization metamodel. A metamodel represents the formal definition of the models structure. It enumerates the set of attributes that form each model. You can both specify the metamodel manually or have Rhizosphere infer it automatically from your models.
  • Define the visualization renderer. The renderer is responsible for providing a visual representation of models.
  • Attach the widget.

Rhizosphere Concepts provides additional information about the models, metamodels and renderers.

You can feed Rhizosphere the data to visualize in multiple formats. The most natural way is to supply each datapoint (a model in Rhizosphere terminology) as a POJO. To do so, make sure your POJO implements the RhizosphereModel interface and ensure Rhizosphere is prepared to receive your POJOs via prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping) (this is needed because Rhizosphere uses GWT code generation to prepare the necessary translation layers between your POJOs and Rhizosphere internal datamodel): 


   rhizosphere.prepareFor(GWT.create(YourPOJO.class));

Alternatively you can define Rhizosphere models also as JavaScriptObject, a JSONObject, a plain JSON String (that Rhizosphere will parse into a JSON object) instances.

If you use POJOs to describe your data, you can use RhizosphereModelAttribute annotations to instruct Rhizosphere on how to expose your data within the visualization. Rhizosphere will parse the annotations to automatically assemble a suitable metamodel for your data. Alternatively you can manually define the metamodel (either partially or in its entirety) via the RhizosphereMetaModel class (note that manual metamodel definition is the only option if you used opaque objects like JavaScriptObject or JSONObject for your models).

Finally, you define a renderer for your visualization by implementing the RhizosphereRenderer interface.

Rhizosphere can be configured an tweaked via RhizosphereOptions.

Once you have finished configuring Rhizosphere, attach it to your GWT application. Once the visualization completes its initialization it fires a ReadyEvent. After the ReadyEvent has fired, you can programmatically manipulate the visualization: this includes adding and removing visualization models (addModel(Object, RhizosphereCallback1) and related methods) and other operations like filtering (doFilter(Map, RhizosphereCallback)), selection (doSelection(String, Collection, RhizosphereCallback)) and layout changes (doLayout(String, JSONObject, Collection, RhizosphereCallback)).

The following code snippet demonstrates how to initialize a Rhizosphere visualization using POJOs. 


 RhizosphereLoader.getInstance().ensureInjected(new Runnable() {

   public void run() {
     // Create some default options.
     RhizosphereOptions<Employee> options = RhizosphereOptions.create();
     options.setTemplate("default");
     options.setLogLevel(LogLevel.DEBUG);

     // Create a new Rhizosphere visualization suited to display Employee
     // POJOs (not shown here).
     final Rhizosphere rhizosphere = new Rhizosphere<Employee>(options);

     // Makes Rhizosphere aware of the objects that we want to visualize.
     // This step is mandatory if you are using your custom POJOs as
     // Rhizosphere models.
     rhizosphere.prepareFor(GWT.create(Employee.class));

     // Sets the renderer that will visualize each Employee.
     rhizosphere.setRenderer(new EmployeeRenderer());

     // Configure Rhizosphere to use all available space within its
     // container.
     rhizosphere.setWidth("100%");
     rhizosphere.setHeight("100%");
     
     // Attach an event listener to be notified whenever the visualization
     // is ready to accept programmatic actions.
     rhizosphere.addReadyHandler(new ReadyEvent.Handler() {

       public void onReady(ReadyEvent event) {
         if (event.isSuccess()) {
           // The visualization is ready. Add some models to it.
           List employees = new LinkedList();
           employees.add(new Employee(...));
           employees.add(new Employee(...));
           ...
           employees.add(new Employee(...));
           rhizosphere.addModels(employees, null);
         }
       }
     });
     
     // Add Rhizosphere to the GWT app ('container' can be a GWT panel).
     container.add(rhizosphere);
   }
 }

Rhizosphere conforms to the Google Visualization API specifications. If you want to use Rhizosphere as a Google Visualization, see GVizRhizosphere.

Author:
battlehorse@google.com (Riccardo Govoni), dinoderek@google.com (Dino Derek Hughes)
See Also:
RhizosphereLoader, GVizRhizosphere

Rhizosphere

Rhizosphere

public Rhizosphere(RhizosphereOptions<T> options)
Creates a new instance of the visualization.

Parameters:
options - Visualization configuration options. You cannot reuse options between different visualizations. Each visualization must have a separate instance of RhizosphereOptions.
Method Detail

prepareFor

public void prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping<T> mapping)
Prepares Rhizosphere to handle custom POJOs as visualization models. You must invoke this method before passing your models to Rhizosphere (that is, before your first call to addModel(Object, RhizosphereCallback1)). If the visualization uses opaque models (JavaScriptObject, JSONObject or JSON strings), it is not necessary to call this method. After calling this method, an automatically built RhizosphereMetaModel will be available for customization via getMetaModel().

Parameters:
mapping - A class capable of converting custom POJOs to objects that Rhizosphere knows how to manage. You can create mapping instances by passing the POJO class to GWT.create, e.g.: rhizo.prepareFor(GWT.create(yourPOJO.class));).

prepareFor

public void prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping<T> mapping,
                       JsoBuilder jsoBuilder)
Prepares Rhizosphere to handle custom POJOs as visualization model. See prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping) for further details.

Parameters:
mapping - A class capable of converting custom POJOs to objects that Rhizosphere knows how to manage. You can create mapping instances by passing the POJO class to GWT.create, e.g.: rhizo.prepareFor(GWT.create(yourPOJO.class));).
jsoBuilder - A custom JsoBuilder to convert between POJOs and JavaScriptObjects. If null, a default one will be used.

prepareFor

public void prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping<T> mapping,
                       JsoBuilder jsoBuilder,
                       AttributeBuilder attributeBuilder)
Prepares Rhizosphere to handle custom POJOs as visualization model. See prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping) for further details.

Parameters:
mapping - A class capable of converting custom POJOs to objects that Rhizosphere knows how to manage. You can create mapping instances by passing the POJO class to GWT.create, e.g.: rhizo.prepareFor(GWT.create(yourPOJO.class));).
jsoBuilder - A custom JsoBuilder to convert between POJOs and JavaScriptObjects. If null, a default one will be used.
attributeBuilder - A custom AttributeBuilder to extract metamodel information from annotated POJOs. If null, a default one will be used.

prepareFor

public void prepareFor(java.lang.Object mapping)
Alternative for prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping) to save the caller from having to cast the output of GWT.create.

Parameters:
mapping -

setMetaModel

public void setMetaModel(RhizosphereMetaModel meta)
Sets the visualization metamodel. If custom POJOs are used as visualization models, a metamodel is automatically built based on RhizosphereModelAttribute annotations found on the POJOs. It is therefore not necessary to define an explicit metamodel. If opaque model types are used (JavaScriptObject, JSONObject, JSON string), defining a metamodel is mandatory.

Parameters:
meta - The visualization metamodel.

getMetaModel

public RhizosphereMetaModel getMetaModel()
Returns the visualization metamodel. If custom POJOs are used as visualization models, a metamodel is automatically built based on RhizosphereModelAttribute annotations found on the POJOs and this method can be used to access it for further customization. If opaque model types are used (JavaScriptObject, JSONObject, JSON string), this method will return null until a metamodel is explicitly provided via setMetaModel(RhizosphereMetaModel).

Returns:
The visualization metamodel.

setRenderer

public void setRenderer(RhizosphereRenderer<T> renderer)
Sets the visualization renderer. You can avoid setting the renderer if you already provide one via RhizosphereOptions options.

Parameters:
renderer - The visualization renderer.

addModel

public void addModel(T modelToAdd,
                     RhizosphereCallback1<RhizosphereModelRef> cb)
Adds the specified model to the visualization. Models can be defined as JavaScriptObject, JSONObject, String (assumed to represent a JSON-encoded object) or custom POJOs. If custom POJOs are used, Rhizosphere must first be prepared to handle them via prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping). If multiple models needs to be added at the same time, it is strongly recommended to use the addModels(Collection, RhizosphereCallback1) alternative, for performance reasons.

Parameters:
modelToAdd - The model, i.e. a datapoint of the dataset you want to visualize, to add.
cb - An optional callback describing whether the operation was successful or not. When successful, the callback will contain an opaque reference to the model just added, that can be later used for other programmatic actions that address specific models.
Throws:
com.google.gwt.json.client.JSONException - If the model type is a String and it cannot be successfully converted into a JSON object.
RhizosphereException - If prepareFor was not called with the correct class before passing a custom POJO to this method.

addModels

public void addModels(java.util.Collection<T> modelsToAdd,
                      RhizosphereCallback1<java.util.List<RhizosphereModelRef>> cb)
Adds one or more models to the visualization. Models can be defined as JavaScriptObject, JSONObject, String (assumed to represent a JSON-encoded object) or custom POJOs. If custom POJOs are used, Rhizosphere must first be prepared to handle them via prepareFor(RhizosphereMapping).

Parameters:
modelsToAdd - The models, i.e. datapoints of the dataset you want to visualize, to add.
cb - An optional callback describing whether the operation was successful or not. When successful, the callback will contain a list of opaque references to the models just added, that can be later used for other programmatic actions that address specific models. The list ordering matches the one of the input modelsToAdd collection.
Throws:
com.google.gwt.json.client.JSONException - If the model type is a String and it cannot be successfully converted into a JSON object.
RhizosphereException - If prepareFor was not called with the correct class before passing custom POJOs to this method.

removeModel

public void removeModel(RhizosphereModelRef modelRef,
                        RhizosphereCallback cb)
Removes one model from the visualization.

Parameters:
modelRef - A reference to the model to remove.
cb - An optional callback describing the outcome of the requested operation.

removeModels

public void removeModels(java.util.Collection<RhizosphereModelRef> modelRefs,
                         RhizosphereCallback cb)
Removes one or more models from the visualization.

Parameters:
modelRefs - A collection of references pointing to the models to remove.
cb - An optional callback describing the outcome of the requested operation.

doFilter

public void doFilter(java.lang.String name,
                     com.google.gwt.json.client.JSONValue value,
                     RhizosphereCallback cb)
Programmatically applies a faceted filter on visualization models on the given model attribute.

Parameters:
name - The name of the Rhizosphere model attribute, as defined by RhizosphereModelAttribute.name(), the filter applies to.
value - The filtering criteria. The specific format of the filtering criteria depends on the attribute kind. For example, attributes with the RANGE kind expect the criteria to be a JSONObject with two numeric min and max entries. Use a null to remove any pre-existing filter on the attribute.
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the filter operation.

doFilter

public void doFilter(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.google.gwt.json.client.JSONValue> filters,
                     RhizosphereCallback cb)
Programmatically applies one or more faceted filters on visualization models.

Parameters:
filters - The set of filters to apply. Each key should be a valid Rhizosphere model attribute name, as defined by RhizosphereModelAttribute.name(), for a filter to apply to. Each value should represent the filtering criteria. The specific format of the filtering criteria depends on the attribute kind. For example, attributes with the RANGE kind expect the criteria to be a JSONObject with two numeric min and max entries. Use a null to remove any pre-existing filter on the attribute.
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the filter operation.

doFilter

public void doFilter(com.google.gwt.json.client.JSONObject filterObj,
                     RhizosphereCallback cb)
As doFilter(Map, RhizosphereCallback), with the filters defined as a JSONObject instead of a Map.

Parameters:
filterObj - The set of filters to apply.
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the filter operation.

doResetFilters

public void doResetFilters(RhizosphereCallback cb)
Programmatically resets all the filters currently applied to visualization models.

Parameters:
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the filter operation.

doSelection

public void doSelection(java.lang.String action,
                        java.util.Collection<RhizosphereModelRef> models,
                        RhizosphereCallback cb)
Programmatically performs a selection operation on the visualization models. Different types of operations can be performed. See rhizo.seletion.js for the list of supported operations.

Parameters:
action - The type of operation to perform.
models - The collection of visualization models the operation applies to. Not all operations use this parameter and it can be optionally omitted at times. Refer to the documentation above for details. Use null when unneeded.
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the selection operation.

doSelection

public void doSelection(java.lang.String action,
                        java.util.Collection<RhizosphereModelRef> models,
                        boolean incremental,
                        RhizosphereCallback cb)
Programmatically performs a selection operation on the visualization models. Different types of operations can be performed. See rhizo.seletion.js for the list of supported operations.

Parameters:
action - The type of operation to perform.
models - The collection of visualization models the operation applies to. Not all operations use this parameter and it can be optionally omitted at times. Refer to the documentation above for details. Use null when unneeded.
incremental - Whether the operation should be incremental or not. Relevant only for 'hide' and 'focus' operations.
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the selection operation.

doLayout

public void doLayout(java.lang.String engine,
                     com.google.gwt.json.client.JSONObject state,
                     java.util.Collection<RhizosphereModelPosition> positions,
                     RhizosphereCallback cb)
Programmatically changes the layout algorithm to visually arrange visualization models.

Parameters:
engine - The layout engine to use. Must be one the valid engine names as defined in rhizo.layout.js in the rhizo.layout.layouts structure. Use null to re-use the current layout engine.
state - The layout state to use. The state is the set of configuration options that each layout engine accepts to customize its behavior. The state definition is layout-specific. Use null to let the layout use its last (or default) state.
positions - An optional collection of explicit positioning information for visualization models, that will override any position the layout engine would otherwise define. Leave null if unneeded.
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the layout operation.

clearErrors

public void clearErrors(RhizosphereCallback cb)
Remove all error notifications currently showing in the visualization.

Parameters:
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the error removal operation.

addError

public void addError(java.lang.String errorDetails,
                     RhizosphereCallback cb)
Adds an error notification to the visualization. The notification will not be displayed unless RhizosphereOptions.setShowErrorsInViewport(boolean) is set to true.

Parameters:
errorDetails - The contents of the error notification.
cb - An optional callback invoked with the outcome of the error addition operation.
